snippet: Rising oil prices and a boom in shale exploration are leading companies to add office space in the Houston area, most notably Exxon Mobil.
abstract: Houston, Texas, powered by a rise in oil prices and a shale exploration boom, is the first major metropolitan region to regain all the jobs lost in the recession, adding 76,000 jobs in 2011, and on pace to pick up tens of thousands more in 2012; oil and gas companies, most notably Exxon Mobil, are moving forward with expansion and relocation plans, putting up new buildings and leasing commercial space in the Houston area.
lead_paragraph: Rising oil prices and a boom in shale exploration are leading companies to add office space in the Houston area, most notably Exxon Mobil.

headline.seo: Energy Spurs a Recovery in Houston Real Estate
headline.main: Energy Spurs a Recovery in Houston
headline.print_headline: Energy Spurs a Recovery in Houston
